intro: Chamaecrista setosa var. paucivenia, commonly known as the slender crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces and has a distinctive, branched inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Its seeds are enclosed in small, pod-like fruits that split open upon maturity to release the seeds.
